page.title: 19CIDER MAKING-WATCHFIELD
page.content: THE SIGN CIDER AND THE CIDER VAT ENCOURAGES LOCALS AND VISITORS ALIKE TO STOP. MR.RICH WAS ABLE TO SHOW US AROUND HIS CIDER MAKING PLANT.HE PROCESSES LOCAL APPLES,ABOUT 20,000 TONS IN A YEAR. THE APPLES ARE FIRST CUT UP AND THEN MADE UP INTO A CHEESE.THIS CONSISTS OF ALTERNATIVE LAYERS OF APPLES AND NYLON CLOTH.THE APPLE JUICE IS SQUEEZED OUT IN ONE OF THREE HYDRAULIC PRESSES.THE JUICE IS PUMPED INTO ONE OF FIVE VATS,RANGING FROM 4,000 TO 10,000 GALLONS.THERE THE JUICE FERMENTS,IT IS RACKED AND STORED. SOME CIDER MATURES IN THREE MONTHS,OTHERS NEED SIX MONTHS OR LONGER.THE CIDER,ABOUT 200,000 GALLONS EACH YEAR,IS SOLD TO CALLERS AND ALSO IS SOLD THROUGHOUT BRITAIN.
